intro: Blepharipappus oreganus, commonly known as the Oregon pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive involucral bracts. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in late summer, and the plant produces fluffy, seed-bearing structures called pappi. Blepharipappus oreganus is often found in regions with mild, moist summers and cool, dry winters.
